name: Goddess Curry Chicken Salad
description: This Curry Chicken Salad is super clean and SO delicious. Loaded with spiced chicken, golden raisins, pistachios, herbs, and Greek yogurt + olive oil as a stand-in for mayo.
keywords: curry chicken salad, chicken salad, lunch recipe, lunch meal prep, chicken salad no fruit, everything bagel, chicken salad sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the chicken breasts in half horizontally so they are very thin. Sprinkle chicken with curry powder, garlic powder, and onion powder. Season with salt and pepper. Sauté in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat with a drizzle of olive oil until golden brown and cooked through. When cooled, chop the chicken into small pieces and chill in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the chicken:

video.name: Curry Chicken Salad Step 1
video.description: Cut the chicken breasts in half horizontally so they are very thin. Sprinkle chicken with an even coating of curry powder, garlic powder, and onion powder. Season with salt and pepper. Sauté in a nonstick skillet over medium high heat until golden brown and cooked through. When cooled, chop the chicken into small pieces and chill in the fridge.

recipeInstructions.text: : Once the chicken is cool enough, mix in a medium bowl with all remaining ingredients. Season to taste with more curry powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and (obvi) salt and pepper. Serve over greens, on a croissant, on toast, in a wrap, or my personal favorite: on an everything bagel.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble your Curry Chicken Salad

video.name: Curry Chicken Salad Step 2
video.description: Once the chicken is cool enough, mix in a medium bowl with all remaining ingredients. Season to taste with more curry powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and (obvi) salt and pepper. Serve over greens, on a croissant, on toast, in a wrap, or my personal favorite: on an everything bagel.

review.reviewBody: This looks absolutely fantastic. I love the curry flavor so it is definitely my kind of chicken salad. I love the addition of little micro greens. Looks so fancy :)
Goddessy Indeed! and I will definitely use the mint!
Made it yesterday. Healthy and delish! Will definitely be making it again.
Hi! I love your recipes, Thanks for sharing this post I appreciate your great effort in bringing all the tips together in the single post. Wish you all the best.
Not gonna lie I couldn't agree more, I wanna know your thoughts to help me decide if it should pull the trigger and make it :)
I've followed your blog for quite a while and I always love your posts and recipes! Can you please make a recipe for napa chicken salad?? It's on of my favorites for sandwiches :) thank you!! Xoxo
Delicious! We added cayenne, some diced jalapenos, and chives. Even my "yuck, Greek yogurt" husband loved it.
